sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
**Credence** is innovative because it brings something that doesn’t exist yet in Cardano: AI-verified identity that users can reuse across multiple apps without repeating KYC. Here’s what makes it unique:



- **AI\-powered verification instead of manual checks: **Most identity systems still rely on slow document uploads and human review. Credence uses OCR, face matching, liveness checks, and fraud detection to verify identity quickly and accurately.
- **Reusable credentials instead of repeating KYC everywhere: **Today, users must verify themselves again on every exchange, wallet, marketplace, or dApp. Credence turns identity into a reusable credential that can be shared across apps with one click.
- **Privacy by design: **No raw documents or photos ever go on-chain. Only proofs and hashed records are stored, so users keep control of their personal data.
- **A bridge between real identity and Web3: **Existing Web3 identity tools focus on wallet activity, reputation, or social login. They don’t verify real people. Credence adds a strong, AI-validated identity layer that works across decentralized applications.
- **Instant verification for builders: **dApps can verify a user without handling documents, reducing cost, complexity, and risk. This is a big step forward for developers who don’t want to manage sensitive data.
- **Not just a KYC service, but an ecosystem trust layer: **Because the credentials are portable, the more projects adopt it, the stronger the shared identity network becomes.



**Why this is new to Cardano**



Cardano has no reusable, AI-verified identity credential.

No project currently combines machine-learning verification with decentralized, user-controlled credentials.

Credence fills the gap between pure decentralized identifiers (which don’t verify real-world identity) and traditional KYC (which is slow, repetitive, and centralized).



**In simple terms**



Credence lets users prove who they are once, and take that proof anywhere.



- No app needs to rebuild KYC.
- No user needs to repeat it.
- And no one exposes personal data on-chain.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Our MVP will demonstrate the full journey of reusable identity on testnet. It will show how a user verifies themselves once and then uses that credential across apps. Specifically, the prototype will demonstrate:



- **AI\-powered verification: **Users can upload an ID and selfie to see how document checks, face matching, and fraud detection work.



- **Creation of a reusable credential: **After verification, the system issues a testnet credential whose proof is stored on-chain.



- **User dashboard: **Users can view their credential status, expiration, and verification history.



- **Verifier portal: **Apps and dApps can verify a user’s credential instantly using only a proof, without handling personal documents.



- **Developer SDK demo: **A simple JavaScript example will show how builders can plug verification into their own apps.



**Where it can be accessed**



- A hosted web link to the Credence Testnet MVP
- A public testnet smart contract address
- A GitHub repo with the SDK, docs, and demo verifier app



**How the community can help**



- Test the verification flow
- Use the verifier portal
- Integrate the SDK into small demo projects
- Provide usability and reliability feedback



This ensures the MVP is testable on-chain, open to the community, and ready for refinement before mainnet launch.

sub_fields.title: Describe realistic measures of success, ideally with on-chain metrics.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
Our measures of success focus on real usage and verifiable on-chain activity. A successful MVP should show that users can complete verification, receive a credential, and have that credential validated by different apps on testnet. We expect modest but meaningful numbers that match an early prototype rather than a full commercial rollout.



**On\-chain success indicators**



- 1,000–1,500 identity credentials issued on testnet during the pilot phase.
- 3,000–5,000 smart contract calls, including credential issuance, revocation checks, and verifier lookups.
- Three or more dApps or developer teams integrating the verification SDK into their testnet applications.



**User and adoption indicators**



- At least 500 real pilot testers completing end-to-end verification using the MVP.
- Completion rate above 70% for the verification process, showing that the onboarding flow works smoothly.
- Feedback from pilot partners confirming that using a reusable credential reduces the need for repeated KYC.



**Performance indicators**



- Verification time under 10 seconds for users with an existing credential.
- No critical issues found in contract audits or community testing.



These targets are achievable within the scope of a prototype and reflect activity levels seen in similar decentralized identity pilots. They give us clear signals that the system works, that developers can integrate it, and that users are willing to adopt reusable identity credentials.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
The problem we are solving is simple: people are forced to repeat KYC and identity checks every time they join a new platform. This slows everything down, increases onboarding costs, and creates frustration for both users and developers. On Cardano, this challenge limits adoption because many dApps need identity verification but do not want to handle documents, personal data, or build KYC systems from scratch. Our solution addresses this by letting users verify themselves once and then reuse that verified credential across multiple applications.



Credence takes a practical approach by combining AI verification with on-chain credential proofs. The AI layer handles document checks, face matching, and fraud detection. Once a user is verified, they receive a reusable credential whose proof is stored on-chain. Any platform can verify this credential instantly without accessing personal documents. This approach keeps user data private while giving developers a reliable way to know that a user is real and unique. We chose this method because it avoids complicated, paperwork-heavy KYC flows and gives users full control of their own identity.



Our project will engage everyday users who want faster onboarding and developers who want a secure verification layer without managing sensitive data. We will demonstrate impact through measurable on-chain activity: number of credentials issued, verification calls from partner dApps, and usage metrics collected during the pilot. We will also track user feedback and completion rates to show that the onboarding experience is genuinely improving.



What makes Credence unique is the combination of AI-driven verification, reusable credentials, and a privacy-first design. It removes unnecessary friction from onboarding, reduces fraud risk, and gives builders a reusable identity tool that benefits the whole ecosystem. For Cardano, this is important because it unlocks safer dApps, lowers barriers for new users, and provides the foundation for identity-driven applications such as compliant DeFi, marketplaces, lending, and community governance. The project doesn’t just solve one problem, it creates long-term value by giving the ecosystem a trusted identity layer that can be reused over and over.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
Credence strengthens the wider Cardano ecosystem by giving users and developers access to a reusable, AI-verified identity layer. This reduces onboarding friction across dApps, prevents repeated KYC checks, and lowers the cost and risk for builders who don’t want to handle sensitive documents. A shared identity credential also makes the ecosystem safer by reducing fraud and helping new users join applications more easily.



We’ll measure impact using both quantitative and qualitative indicators. On-chain metrics will track the number of credentials issued, verification calls made by partner dApps, and interactions with the smart contracts. Off-chain metrics will include user feedback from pilot groups, verification completion rates, and adoption by developers who integrate the SDK. We will also gather comments from partners to understand how reusable identity affects their onboarding speed and operational costs.



All outputs will be shared openly with the community. The SDK, documentation site, demos, and testnet deployment will be publicly accessible for anyone to use or test. We will provide progress updates, pilot reports, and final results on GitHub, in Catalyst channels, and through community calls. By sharing both the tools and the lessons learned, we hope to support other teams building identity-aware applications and encourage more projects to adopt reusable credentials across the Cardano ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
Our team has the skills and experience needed to deliver Credence with a high level of trust and accountability. We cover AI/ML engineering, blockchain development, frontend development, community engagement, and business strategy, which allows us to build every part of the system in-house. Each team member has worked on technical projects that required careful planning, documentation, and secure handling of data, which is crucial for an identity-focused product like this.



To ensure feasibility, we designed our approach around proven technologies: open-source AI libraries for verification, well-established smart contract patterns, and a lightweight credential model that avoids storing personal data on-chain. Before building the MVP, we prepared a clear architecture and workflow that shows exactly how AI and on-chain proofs interact. We will validate feasibility through testnet deployments, pilot testing, and measurable usage from real users and partner dApps.



We also have processes in place to manage funds responsibly. Every milestone has specific outputs, acceptance criteria, and documentation requirements. Progress will be tracked publicly through GitHub, where code, updates, and reports will be visible to the community. We will share monthly updates, publish our deliverables openly, and use the budget only for planned development, testing, and deployment tasks. By keeping our work transparent and milestone-driven, we ensure the community can trust both our process and our final results.

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
# Cost Breakdown
Our total funding request is ₳116,000, aligned directly with the five milestones in our development plan. Each milestone has its own resource needs, including engineering, infrastructure, documentation, project management, community testing, and audit requirements. All costs reflect future work only.



**1\. Planning, Architecture & Research — ₳17,000**

**Resources needed:**

- AI/ML design work
- System architecture
- Credential schema design
- Compliance and privacy review
- Project management

This phase establishes the foundation for the entire project. Most of the cost covers the time required to produce detailed technical documentation, map verification flows, and prepare a clear plan for all components.



**2\. AI Verification Engine Development — ₳40,000**

**Resources needed:**

- OCR model development
- Face match + liveness algorithms
- Fraud detection heuristics
- API engineering
- Internal QA and evaluation
- Cloud compute for model testing

This is the most resource-intensive stage. It requires sustained engineering effort, experimentation, and cloud infrastructure to build the AI pipeline. We are using open-source tools (TensorFlow, OpenCV), so no license costs are required. Cloud costs include GPU/CPU compute for model runs during development.



**3\. Smart Contract Layer — ₳35,000**

**Resources needed:**

- Smart contract development
- Testnet deployment
- Contract testing
- SDK bindings
- Internal audit + external review
- Documentation

This phase includes the credential issuance logic, revocation registry, and verification proof checker. A portion of the budget covers a lightweight third-party code review to ensure security and correctness before public testing.



**4\. Frontend, SDK, Documentation & Integration Toolkit — ₳32,000**

**Resources needed:**

- Identity dashboard
- Verifier portal
- JavaScript SDK
- API gateway
- Documentation website
- Demo video
- UX testing

This milestone covers everything needed for the community to interact with the MVP, including a full SDK and clear onboarding materials. The demo video supports community testing and transparency.



**5\. Pilot Testing, Community Validation & Final Deployment — ₳26,000**

**Resources needed:**

- Pilot testing with 500 users
- Integration with 2–3 partner dApps
- Community engagement sessions
- Bug fixes and optimization
- Reporting and documentation
- Testnet → mainnet preparation

This cost includes community engagement, pilot management, data collection, and final reporting. We also budgeted for minor infrastructure costs needed during the pilot period.



**Third\-Party Services Used**

- Cloud compute (AI model training & API hosting): Standard cloud infrastructure for development and testing.
- Contract audit: A lightweight external review for contract security.
- Documentation hosting: Low-cost web hosting for docs (or GitHub Pages).

No proprietary software licenses are required. All AI frameworks and tools used are open-source.



**Publicity, Community Engagement & Reporting**

- We allocated part of Milestone 5 for:
- Community testing coordination
- Feedback collection
- Pilot partner support
- Final reporting back to the Catalyst community

This ensures transparency and proper communication during the project.



**Project Management & Documentation Costs**

Each milestone includes dedicated PM hours for:

- Weekly sync meetings
- Documentation updates
- Coordination between engineering tracks
- Maintaining the project board and reporting



This avoids common budgeting gaps and reflects real workload needs.

The current proposal fully covers MVP design, development, testing, and deployment.

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
The cost of this project represents strong value for the Cardano ecosystem because it delivers a reusable identity infrastructure that many dApps, fintech platforms, and marketplaces can rely on. Instead of each project building its own KYC or verification system, Credence provides a shared, AI-powered identity layer that reduces onboarding friction, cuts development costs, and increases safety across the ecosystem. This makes the investment beneficial not only for our team, but for every builder who wants to integrate secure identity features without managing sensitive data.



The budget is proportional to the amount of engineering effort required. AI verification, smart contract development, and SDK creation each require specialized skills with rates comparable to standard freelance and professional engineering work. For example, typical software engineering and AI development rates in our region range between $15–$30/hour, and blockchain specialists often charge higher due to the required security and audit expectations. The milestones and costs reflect realistic labor hours for building a working MVP, not inflated numbers. We also budgeted carefully for testing, documentation, pilot support, and community engagement, which are commonly overlooked but essential for a successful launch.



Because Credence can be reused by multiple projects, the ecosystem gains more value than the cost of building it. Every dApp that adopts the system saves money, avoids repeated KYC processes, and benefits from faster onboarding for their users. By funding this project once, Catalyst supports a long-term identity solution that strengthens trust, reduces fraud, and improves user experience across the entire network.
